turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ryan Stiles.
turn.1: What show did Ryan Stiles appear on first?
turn.2: By 1989, Stiles had gained the attention of the producers of the British improvisational comedy show "Whose Line Is It Anyway?". Stiles was a regular on the show until its end in 1998.
turn.3: Did he have a lot of fans on "Whose Line"?
turn.4: His performance on the program earned him both critical praise and a devoted fan following in the United Kingdom.
turn.5: What Carey show did he appear on?
turn.6: In 1995, Stiles was asked by American comic Drew Carey to be a regular on his comedy "The Drew Carey Show".
turn.7: What was his role on "The Carey Show"?
turn.8: Stiles played Drew's erudite but underachieving best friend, Lewis Kiniski.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: In 1998, Carey successfully lobbied ABC to get an American version of "Whose Line Is It Anyway?" produced.
turn.12: Following the final season of the British version in 1998, the American version premiered, with both Stiles and Carey credited as executive producers.
